TopicTitle: North Star Aerospace - Grand Opening "Salamander" Prototype

Articles.Content:
North Star Aerospace

Performance aircraft division

Introducing, North Star Aerospace! A brand new Aerospace company now producing both Air and space craft! Its true, we are brand new, but we take an uncomprimising approach to building and operating our aircraft that allows us to come up with many new and unique approaches to many of today's major aviation and space flight problems! To show you what we mean, let us introduce our first aircraft ever, the prototype NSA-001A "Salamander" VTOL craft. now ready for both Commercial, Millitary and Private testing!

[

All this and more you can expect along with quality engineering and intelligent design. All for improving the design(and aesthetics) of Air and spacecraft the world over! Expect more brilliance in the next few months as we release newer editions of the Salamander, and other design variations!

North Star Aerospace! The Best and Brightest!

[More to come in a few hours]
Nice. The VTOL aircraft i make always flip. Hope the physics for airplanes are improved in the next update. They are too damn similar to space fairing vehicles.

What mods did you use ?

Hmm, Yes, I am wondering that too. It sort of reminds me of the VTOL Fighter from SAints row 3?

Also, How does the nose of the aircraft remain stable, Ass all lift is at the back? (unless I am missing something?)

To be truthful, the aircraft is about as stable as a mental patient. Im refining it as we speak, but for it to fly for a period of time requires constant course correction and compensation of nose lift/tail lift.

update: Oddly enough, the Salamander seems to fly much better with TWO canard wings instead of one on it's VTOL rotor pylons. And even takes off at a better vertical angle too. Now, kep an eye out for the NSA-001B version of the Salamander, as well as two versions of my new up and coming craft the NSA-002 Drake!
